comment: A very strong generalization of the Axiom of Replacement (compare ~ zfrep6 ), derived from the Collection Principle ~ cp . Its strength lies in the rather profound fact that ` ph ( x , y ) ` does not have to be a "function-like" wff, as it does in the standard Axiom of Replacement. This theorem is sometimes called the Boundedness Axiom. (Contributed by NM, 17-Oct-2004.)
